sentence.Network_en: He was executed in 1887 for plotting to assassinate the tsar.
sentence.Network_cn: 他因密谋暗杀沙皇在1887年被判处极刑.

sentence.Network_en: He assumed full authority as tsar in 1689.
The tsar protected his personal prerogatives.
sentence.Network_cn: 沙皇维护了自己的私人特权.

PerfectNetExp.abs: “沙皇”（TSAR）原意是莫斯科大公国的俄罗斯人，对拜占庭皇帝及钦察汗国的一种尊称。可是自伊凡四世自己称呼起沙皇之后，“沙皇…

时在位的沙皇亚历山大一世（Tsar Alexander）的确就这麽做过。但在国内从未尝试过自由主义。
the tsar was just a paper tiger .沙皇不过是一只纸老虎。
The White House ' s acting cyber - security tsar has resigned according to the Wall Street Journal., 华尔街日报报道 , 白宫代理网络安全官员已辞职.

derivation.yuyuan_name: from Russian tsar', representing Latin Caesar

entry.def: In former times, the tsar was the king of Russia.
A particular kind of tsar is a person who has been appointed by the government to deal with a particular problem that is affecting the country.

example.ex: ...the former New York police chief who was appointed as 'drug tsar' by Bill Clinton...
example.tran: 被比尔·克林顿任命为“反毒特使”的前纽约警察局局长

example.ex: He promised to appoint an AIDS czar to deal with the disease.
example.tran: 他许诺任命一位艾滋病大使来应对这种疾病。

means.word_mean: 1. a male monarch or emperor (especially of Russia prior to 1917)
